intro: Silene scouleri var. pacifica, commonly known as Pacific stonecrop, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and clusters of pink or red flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in alpine or subalpine environments. It is adapted to cold climates and can withstand harsh weather conditions. Its unique appearance and ecological role make it a notable species in its native habitat.
